  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    2.0 This application constructs a simplified restaurant seating system, that uses several list ADT's that were constructed during labs this semester for its data structures.
    Author:
    Sal Ficara

      • sectionBuilder

        private static int[] sectionBuilder(ListArrayBasedPlus sec,
                                    java.io.BufferedReader read,
                                    MyListReferenceBased numList)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Uses a section list and a number list to determine the proper parameters needed to successfully construct a new Table object. These two values are returned via an int array. This method also has built in error checking to ensure that no duplicate table numbers are made.
        Parameters:
        sec - A ListArrayBasedPlus ADT structure representing either kid or adult section
        read - A buffered reader object
        numList - A MyListReferenceBased ADT structure containing table numbers from one of the sections
        Returns:
        int[] return int array containing the number of seats in position 1 and the table number in position 2
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.io.IOException

      • tableFinder

        private static Table tableFinder(ListArrayBasedPlus section,
                                 Party p)
        Used to locate the tables the are not currently occupied so a party can be seated.
        Parameters:
        section - A ListArrayBasedPlus ADT structure of either the kid or adult section
        p - A party object, needed to get the size of current party
        Returns:
        boolean of value true in a proper table is found and null otherwise

      • tableRemover

        private static java.lang.Integer tableRemover(ListArrayBasedPlus sec,
                                              int tableNum)
        Used to locate a proper table to remove from a specified section.
        Parameters:
        sec - A ListArrayBasedPlus ADT of either the kid or adult section
        tableNum - A int representing the table we want to remove
        Returns:
        Integer value that returns a proper index of a table that can be removed, or -2 if a table is found but is currently occupied, or -1 if it does not exits at all

      • calculateAvailableTables

        private static java.lang.String calculateAvailableTables(ListArrayBasedPlus section,
                                                         java.lang.String sectionName)
        Used to gather information on what tables are currently unused or in terms that this program is written in it locates tables that have a currentParty field that is equal to null.
        Parameters:
        section - ListArrayBasedPlus ADT structure that is either a kid or adult section list
        sectionName - name of the section, used in the string thats printed to console
        Returns:
        String that tells you information on what seats are currently available

      • numberFind

                                            java.lang.Integer num)
        Used to locate table numbers.
        Parameters:
        numList - MyListReferenceBased ADT structure that hold either table numbers for the kid or adult section
        num - The number we are searching for
        Returns:
        The index where the number was found if successful otherwise returns null

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                        java.io.IOException
        In its current state the main method uses 7 list ADT structures. 4 of them are of type MyListReferenceBased and the other 3 are of type ListArrayBasedPlus below is a brief description of each list's purpose, lineList -> Holds Party objects, this ADT simulates a line, first come first serve. occupiedTables-> Holds Table objects, which all have a Party object assigned to the class field "currentParty" effectively linking a particular party to the Table. kidsSection -> Contains Table objects that are only in the kid section of the restaurant. Note, when tables are assigned they still remain in this array, the display method(case 6) just ignores tables that have a non-null currentParty field. So these tables remain in this list permanently UNLESS option 5 is used to remove a table. adultSection -> Contains Table objects that are only in the adult section of the restaurant. Everything else is identical to the kidsSection description. nameTracking -> Holds String objects. The purpose of this is to easily access names of all the current parties in the restaurant so that we can easily check for duplicates. kidNumbers -> Holds Integer objects. The purpose of this is to easily access all tables numbers in the kid section so that we can easily check for duplicate table numbers. adultNumbers -> Serves the exact same purpose as about but for the adult tables instead. As for the cases themselves, it is self explanatory from the selection menu what they do. All code inside the cases is generally using the private static methods above to accomplish the goal of whichever case you are looking at.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.io.IOException
